勪字的基本解释

勪
qiāo
古同“蹻”。

勪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiāo］
亦作“勪1”。同“蹺1”。
[②]［jiǎo］
［《廣韻》居夭切，上小，見。］
亦作“勪2”。
(1)高傲不屈。
(2)壮健；勇武。
[③]［jué］
［《廣韻》居勺切，入藥，見。］
亦作“勪3”。
(1)屐、鞋。古代多指草鞋。
(2)不稳定貌。

勪字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【力字部】　勪； 康熙笔画：14； 页码：页149第19
【集韻】極虐切，音噱。本作蹻，舉足行高也。

勪字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
勪字的起名意思

暂无。

Ming
Basic explanation of words
Ming
qiāo
The ancient same "flies".
Ming
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiāo］
Also known as "Meng 1". Same as "Zoom 1".
[②]［jiǎo］
["Guangyun" Juyao cut, upper elementary school, see you. ]
Also known as "Meng 2".
(1) Proud and unyielding.
(2) Robust; brave.
[③] [jué]
["Guangyun" cut in a spoon, used as medicine, see. ]
Also known as "Meng 3".
(1) Clogs, shoes. Ancient multi-finger straw sandals.
(2) Unstable appearance.
Ming
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Li Zi Department] 　勪; Kangxi Strokes: 14; Page Number: Page 149 Page 19
[Jiyun] Extremely cruel, sound stunt. This book is a swan, and it's also a good way to go.
